questions.question: When is the hackathon?
questions.answer: The hackathon will take place from October 4th to October 11th.

questions.question: Hello
questions.answer: Hello, Good to have you here

questions.question: How can I register for the hackathon?
questions.answer: You can register by visiting the 'Register/Submit Idea' section on our website and filling out the registration form.

questions.question: What are the rules for the hackathon?
questions.answer: You can find the detailed rules and guidelines on our website.

questions.question: What is the theme of the hackathon?
questions.answer: ITAM and Hybrid FinOps, TI Platform, AI, Sustainability, Security, Quality, Cost Reduction, Customer Adoption, Sales Cycle, Customer Offboarding

questions.question: Who can participate in the hackathon?
questions.answer: The hackathon is open to Only flexera employees

questions.question: Are there any prizes for the winners?
questions.answer: Yes, we have exciting prizes including cash awards

questions.question: Can I participate as a solo participant?
questions.answer: Yes, you can participate individually or as part of a team.

questions.question: What is the maximum team size?
questions.answer: The maximum team size is 4-5 members.

questions.question: Will there be any workshops or talks?
questions.answer: Yes, we have a lineup of workshops by SME's on Databricks, AWS and Data/AI trainings

questions.question: What is the deadline for registration?
questions.answer: The registration deadline submit idea and register is august 25th.

questions.question: How can I submit my project idea?
questions.answer: You can submit your project through the 'Submission' portal on our website.

questions.question: Is there any participation fee?
questions.answer: No, participation is completely free.

questions.question: How can I contact the organizers?
questions.answer: You can reach out to Flexhack2024 (Teams channel)

questions.question: What is the judging criteria?
questions.answer: Projects will be judged based on innovation, impact, feasibility, presentation, automated optimizations, user-friendly dashboard.

questions.question: Can I use external APIs in my project?
questions.answer: Yes, you are allowed to use external APIs and libraries.

questions.question: Will there be any pre-hackathon events?
questions.answer: Yes, we have pre-hackathon webinars by SME's.

questions.question: What should I do if I face technical issues during the hackathon?
questions.answer: You can contact our technical support team at techsupport@hackathonwebsite.com.

questions.question: What is the main objective of FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The main objective is to leverage combined Flexera-Snow teams to drive more innovation and collaboration to grow ITAM and Hybrid FinOps, accelerate the TI platform, and explore new use cases in Sustainability and Security (CAASM).

questions.question: When is the FlexHack 2024 launching?
questions.answer: The FlexHack 2024 is scheduled to launch on August 5, 2024.

questions.question: What is the budget allocated for FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The budget allocated for FlexHack 2024 is $12,500 USD.

questions.question: Who can submit ideas for FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: All Flexera & Snow Engineering and Product teams can submit ideas.

questions.question: When will the top 10-15 ideas be announced?
questions.answer: The top 10-15 ideas will be announced between 25th to 30th August.

questions.question: When will the winners be announced?
questions.answer: The winners will be announced in the last week of October 2024, possibly during the Engineering All Hands.

questions.question: What kind of team structure is expected for FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The typical team structure includes 1 PO/PM, 3-4 engineers, and 1 SME (shared resource, sponsored by ELT/PLT as needed).

questions.question: What trainings are planned for FlexHack 2024 participants?
questions.answer: Trainings will leverage Databricks and AWS and will include Data/AI training sessions in August and September 2024.

questions.question: When is the Readout to ELT/PLT scheduled?
questions.answer: The Readout to ELT/PLT is scheduled for 18th July.

questions.question: When will FlexHack be launched?
questions.answer: FlexHack will be launched on 5th August.

questions.question: What is the timeline for sourcing ideas for FlexHack?
questions.answer: Ideas will be sourced and approved by ELT/PLT from 5th August to 25th August.

questions.question: When will the ideas be finalized?
questions.answer: The finalization of the idea backlog (Top ~15) will occur between 25th August to 30th August.

questions.question: When will the challenges be announced and sign-ups take place?
questions.answer: The challenges will be announced, and sign-ups will take place from 2nd September to 6th September.

questions.question: What are the dates for the execution phase?
questions.answer: The challenge execution phase will occur from 4th October to 11th October.

questions.question: When will the demo presentations and evaluations take place?
questions.answer: The presentations and evaluations are scheduled for the week of 14th October.

questions.question: When will the top 5 teams present their demo to Brian?
questions.answer: The top 5 teams will present their demo to Brian in the week of 21st October.

questions.question: When will the winners of FlexHack be announced?
questions.answer: The winners will be announced in the week of 28th October.

questions.question: When was the readout to ELT/PLT scheduled?
questions.answer: The readout to ELT/PLT was scheduled for 18th July.

questions.question: What was the timeline for sourcing ideas for FlexHack?
questions.answer: Ideas were sourced and approved by ELT/PLT from 5th August to 25th August.

questions.question: What were the dates for the challenge execution phase?
questions.answer: The challenge execution phase took place from 4th October to 11th October.

questions.question: When did the demo presentations and evaluations take place?
questions.answer: The demo presentations and evaluations took place during the week of 14th October.

questions.question: When was the top 5 demo presentation to Brian scheduled?
questions.answer: The top 5 demo presentation to Brian was scheduled for the week of 21st October.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the readout to ELT/PLT?
questions.answer: The purpose of the readout to ELT/PLT was to provide an overview and updates on FlexHack.

questions.question: What do participants need to submit for FlexHack?
questions.answer: Participants need to submit their respective ideas in a submit form.

questions.question: Who is responsible for reviewing and approving final ideas in FlexHack?
questions.answer: The ELT/PLT is responsible for reviewing and approving final ideas from the overall sourced idea backlog.

questions.question: What is the role of ELT/PLT in the FlexHack idea submission process?
questions.answer: The ELT/PLT is responsible for reviewing and approving the final ideas from the overall sourced idea backlog.

questions.question: Which group has the final say on the approval of FlexHack ideas?
questions.answer: The ELT/PLT group has the final say on the approval of FlexHack ideas.

questions.question: What involvement is expected from SMEs in FlexHack?
questions.answer: SMEs are expected to provide 1-2 hours per week of effort for mentoring and guidance, with overall 5-6 hours needed for the entire event.

questions.question: How much time is required from SMEs during FlexHack?
questions.answer: SMEs are required to spend 1-2 hours per week and overall 5-6 hours for the entire event.

questions.question: What is the expected effort from SMEs for FlexHack?
questions.answer: SMEs are expected to contribute 1-2 hours per week, with a total of 5-6 hours for the entire Hackathon'24 event.

questions.question: What promotional material is needed for FlexHack?
questions.answer: Brief 2-5 minute video challenge overviews are needed for each challenge.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the promotional videos for FlexHack?
questions.answer: The promotional videos, which are 2-5 minutes long, help participating teams understand the problem they need to solve.

questions.question: How long should the promotional challenge overview videos be for FlexHack?
questions.answer: The promotional challenge overview videos should be 2-5 minutes long.

questions.question: What is the evaluation process for FlexHack challenges?
questions.answer: The evaluation process involves criteria set by the ELT/PLT, and they will allocate time slots for evaluating challenge outcomes.

questions.question: How is the evaluation of FlexHack challenges managed?
questions.answer: The ELT/PLT manages the evaluation of FlexHack challenges using set criteria and allocates time slots for this purpose.

questions.question: What should be included in the Hackathon idea template?
questions.answer: The Hackathon idea template should include sections like Idea Title, Sponsor, Theme/Product, Business Driver, PM, Problem Statement, Solution Summary, Solution Details, Acceptance Criteria, Implementation Notes, and Priorities.

questions.question: What is the role of the Sponsor in the Hackathon idea template?
questions.answer: The Sponsor, usually an ELT/PLT member, is responsible for providing guidance and oversight for the challenge.

questions.question: What does the Sponsor do in the context of the Hackathon idea template?
questions.answer: The Sponsor oversees the challenge and provides necessary guidance as part of the Hackathon idea template.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Problem Statement in the Hackathon idea template?
questions.answer: The Problem Statement outlines why the idea is needed, the issues it addresses, and the expected positive impact.

questions.question: What are the guidelines for FlexHack idea submission?
questions.answer: FlexHack ideas must align with the organization's FY25 roadmap/backlog, require 40-60 hours of implementation effort, and be feasible for a team of 4-5 members.

questions.question: What should FlexHack ideas align with?
questions.answer: FlexHack ideas should align with the overall organization’s FY25 roadmap/backlog.

questions.question: How many hours of implementation effort should FlexHack ideas require?
questions.answer: FlexHack ideas should require 40-60 hours of implementation effort.

questions.question: How should FlexHack ideas be scoped?
questions.answer: Ideas should be scoped to align with FY25 goals, require 40-60 hours of work, and be handled by a team of 4-5 members.

questions.question: What is the primary theme of FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The primary themes are ITAM, Hybrid FinOps, TI Platform, AI, Sustainability, Security, Quality, Cost Reduction, Customer Adoption, and Sales Cycle.

questions.question: Who can participate in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: FlexHack 2024 is open to all Flexera and Snow Engineering and Product teams.

questions.question: What themes are prioritized in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: Themes prioritized include ITAM, Hybrid FinOps, TI Platform, AI, Sustainability, Security, Quality, Cost Reduction, Customer Adoption, and Sales Cycle.

questions.question: When is the sign-up period for FlexHack 2024 challenges?
questions.answer: The sign-up period for FlexHack 2024 challenges is from September 2nd to September 6th, 2024.

questions.question: What is the significance of the TI Platform in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The TI Platform is one of the key themes, focusing on upgrading the platform to meet data-driven demands and accelerate innovation.

questions.question: How will the top 5 demos be presented in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The top 5 demos will be presented to Brian during the week of October 21st, 2024.

questions.question: How are the final ideas for FlexHack 2024 selected?
questions.answer: Final ideas are selected by the ELT/PLT based on their alignment with strategic goals and their potential impact.

questions.question: What are the expected deliverables for teams in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: Teams are expected to deliver a solution that aligns with the Problem Statement, meets the Acceptance Criteria, and includes detailed Implementation Notes.

questions.question: What are the priorities for FlexHack 2024 challenges?
questions.answer: Priorities include innovation, alignment with strategic goals, feasibility of implementation, and potential impact on Flexera's business.

questions.question: What kind of impact is expected from FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The expected impact includes improved innovation, enhanced collaboration across teams, and the development of solutions that align with Flexera's strategic goals.

questions.question: Who can nominate SMEs for FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: SMEs can be nominated by the ELT/PLT to provide mentorship and guidance for sponsored challenges.

questions.question: How can teams ensure their ideas are aligned with FlexHack 2024 objectives?
questions.answer: Teams should ensure their ideas align with the FY25 roadmap, are feasible for implementation, and contribute to the key themes identified by the organizers.

questions.question: How will the FlexHack 2024 winners be determined?
questions.answer: Winners will be determined based on the evaluation criteria set by the ELT/PLT, which assesses innovation, feasibility, and impact.

questions.question: How can teams prepare for FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: Teams can prepare by reviewing the Hackathon Idea Template, understanding the key themes, and aligning their ideas with the FY25 roadmap.

questions.question: What is the role of the Problem Statement in the FlexHack 2024 submission process?
questions.answer: The Problem Statement defines the need for the idea, the issues it addresses, and the positive impact it aims to achieve.

questions.question: What kind of solutions are expected from FlexHack 2024 participants?
questions.answer: Participants are expected to develop solutions that are innovative, feasible for implementation, and aligned with the strategic goals outlined by the organizers.

questions.question: What is the focus of FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The focus of FlexHack 2024 is on driving innovation in key areas such as ITAM, Hybrid FinOps, TI Platform, Sustainability, and Security.

questions.question: How can teams make the most of their participation in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: Teams can make the most of their participation by aligning their ideas with strategic goals, focusing on innovation, and collaborating effectively.

questions.question: What are the main benefits of participating in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: Main benefits include the opportunity to drive innovation, collaborate with other teams, and contribute to Flexera's strategic growth.

questions.question: How will the top 5 demos be evaluated in FlexHack 2024?
questions.answer: The top 5 demos will be evaluated by Brian and other senior leaders based on the criteria set by the ELT/PLT.
